https://github.com/leanprover/mathlib/pull/567

This is my PR which includes a formalization of basic probability theory - including Bayes theorem. I intend to make this a foundation for defining random variables, properties of random variables and in particular, a normally distributed random variable.

I currently defined a probability_measure as extending the measure_theory.measure, which maps into ennreal. @Johannes HÃ¶lzl requested me to redefine this as mapping into nnreal or real. But if I do this, it is breaking a lot of proofs and I am unable to directly use the measure_theory library results already proven. Maybe there is a clever way of redefining it which avoids these issues, but I am a beginner and am unable to figure it out.

I just wanted suggestions on how to proceed with this.

Update: As per @Mario Carneiro 's suggestion, I've included a nnreal variant for each lemma I've proven in the original file. Also included are two lemmas has_sum_coe' and tsum_coe' in /topology/instances/ennreal.lean which deal with a finite sum of ennreals having a sum.
